epigraph.text: Doctors are men who prescribe medicines of which they know little, to cure diseases of which they know less, in human beings of whom they know nothing.

points.digest: Argument: "If there were any problems with vaccinations, if they were unsafe or ineffective, doctors would know about it, but at present there is almost complete medical consensus - vaccinations are safe and effective. After all, doctors, for their long years of training, probably learned more about vaccinations than you read about them on the Internet".

My wife also thought vaccines were safe and effective. They were taught this. I asked her how many hours during the whole period of her training she had, had been devoted to vaccinations. It turned out that only a few hours. Of these, for two hours they taught about the vaccination schedule, and for another two hours there was a lecture on "how to respond to anti-vaccination arguments." By the way, after this lecture, almost all the students said that the lecturer's arguments did not convince them, and that the arguments of the anti-vaccinations were more convincing. They, of course, did not think that the anti-vaccine handlers were somehow right. They decided that the lecturer simply did not prepare well for this lecture.

But maybe in other universities everything is different? [That's how much==https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=buQvtnQ7VXA] they teach about vaccinations in the most prestigious American universities. Of the 6,700 pages that a medical college student must learn, only 4 pages are devoted to vaccinations.

Doctors have a financial interest in vaccinations. The more vaccines they sell, the higher their bonus..
The insurance company Blue Cross Blue Shield, for example, [pays==https://wellnessandequality.com/tag/blue-cross-blue-shields-physician-incentive-program] doctors $ 400 for each fully vaccinated child. But only if the percentage of vaccinated in practice is above 63%. This is the main reason pediatricians in the United States [refuse==https://www.forbes.com/sites/tarahaelle/2016/08/29/as-more-parents-refuse-vaccines-more-doctors-dismiss-them-with-aaps-blessing/#678539881f22] to treat unvaccinated children.
Argument: "But I talked with several doctors, and they all say that vaccinations are safe. Moreover, doctors would not have vaccinated their children if they considered vaccinations unsafe ".

Most people believe that a doctor can treat as he sees fit. Far from it. If, for example, a doctor read several scientific articles and came to the conclusion that it is better to treat a certain disease in some other way, he has no right to do so. The doctor must follow the permitted treatment protocols, otherwise he will lose his license. If the doctor advises the patient about any unapproved medicine, for example, to treat whooping cough with vitamin C, and not with an antibiotic, and something happens to the patient, the doctor will go to court. If the doctor prescribes antibiotics ([not particularly effective==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15674946] in whooping cough), and something happens the patient, the doctor will not bear any responsibility. What is the point of the doctor advising the patient something that is not approved by the protocol?
Similarly, the doctor, by and large, does not have the right to advise the patient not to get vaccinated. He may very quickly lose his license (especially in the USA), and even if he does not lose it, his career will not go far.
Nevertheless, there are many doctors openly opposing vaccinations. Of course, these are always doctors with their own private practice.

If you ask my wife, as a doctor, if she advises you to be vaccinated, and she does not trust you, she will answer that she does advise it. Vaccinations, she recites, is the greatest gift of medicine to humanity, they saved millions of lives.
If you ask her if she is vaccinating her child and she trusts you completely, she will explain that she will scratch out the eyes of someone who will approach the child with the vaccine, and will advise you to do the same.
Therefore, it is important to ask the right question. More importantly, the doctor to whom you ask the question must fully trust you, and must not think you could complain about him, or publish his advice.
Of course, most doctors are likely to vaccinate their children. But only because they are taught almost nothing about vaccines. Therefore, it is also important to ask the doctor how many scientific articles about the safety and efficacy of vaccines he has read. Ask him to also give you a chance to read at least one study proving the safety of the vaccine he is about to inject.

Yet many doctors take risks, and do not advise their patients to get vaccinated. Here are a few studies:

points.title: Despite awareness of recommendations, why do not health care workers not immunize pregnant women?
points.digest: Despite the fact that 93% of doctors know that the Ministry of Health recommends vaccinating pregnant women for flu and whooping cough, only 70% follow these guidelines. A third of doctors believe that both vaccinations are dangerous, or that their safety is questionable. 40% of doctors from those who believe that these vaccinations are dangerous, still recommend them to their patients. (Israel)

points.title: How do physicians immunize their own children? Differences among pediatricians and nonpediatricians.
points.digest:
5% of non-pediatric doctors do not vaccinate their children against measles, mumps and rubella. They believe that combined vaccines are unsafe, that it is better to have the disease than to get vaccinated, and that homeopathic treatment works well for these diseases.
10% postpone DTaP vaccination for a later date, 15% postpone MMR vaccination.
A third of the doctors did not vaccinate their children against hepatitis B and hemophilic bacilli. Only 12% were vaccinated against the flu, and only 3% were vaccinated against chickenpox. 34% of pediatricians did not vaccinate their children according to the vaccination schedule.
The survey involved only InfoVac subscribers, that is, doctors who are actively interested in vaccinations. From which it follows that the actual number of doctors who do not vaccinate their children is probably much more. (Switzerland)

points.title: Vaccination practices among physicians and their children.
points.digest:
21% of pediatric specialists and 10% of total pediatricians will refuse at least one vaccination for their child.
19% of specialist pediatricians and 5% of general pediatricians will delay MMR vaccination until 1.5 years of age.
18% of specialist pediatricians will not vaccinate their child against rotavirus, 6% will not vaccinate against hepatitis A. (USA)

points.title: Physicians who do and do not recommend children get all vaccinations.
points.digest:
11% of doctors did not recommend their patients vaccinate their children with all vaccines.
Doctors-therapists did not recommend inoculation twice as often as pediatricians did (therapists earn less on vaccinations).
Doctors trust medical journals more than the CDC and the FDA. They trust pharmaceutical companies less than the Internet. (USA)

points.title: Paediatricians knowledge, attitudes, and practices for immunizations for infants in Italy.
points.digest:
Only 10% of physicians had a good opinion of all vaccines.
60% of doctors would like to know more about vaccines.
Only 25% of doctors gave optional vaccines to their patients (whooping cough, measles, mumps, chickenpox, rubella, Hib, pneumococcus, meningococcus). (Italy)

points.title: Factors associated with vaccination for hepatitis B, pertussis, seasonal and pandemic influenza among French general practitioners: a 2010 survey.
points.digest: 27% of doctor’s families were not vaccinated against hepatitis B, 36% were not vaccinated against whooping cough, 23% were not vaccinated against influenza. (France)

points.title: Knowledge, attitudes, beliefs and practices of general practitioners towards measles and MMR vaccination in southeastern France in 2012.
points.digest:
13% of doctors do not consider measles a dangerous disease. 12% of doctors consider the second dose of MMR to be useless.
33% of doctors do not believe that MMR vaccination should be mandatory for children under 2 years of age. (France)

points.title: What lies behind the low rates of vaccinations among nurses who treat infants?
points.digest:
After Israeli nurses were asked to vaccinate against whooping cough at 3 months, only 2% (two percent) deigned to do so. And we are talking about nurses working in mother and child centers (tipat halav), that is, those whose main role is to vaccinate children.
Most nurses do not trust health authorities, and desperately resist compulsory vaccinations.
They believe that parents should have the choice to vaccinate a child or not, and they demand the same respect for their rights.
Nurses share work and personal life. The fact that their work is to inculcate children is one thing. And whether they are vaccinated themselves or not, it is their own business, and they do not consider it necessary to inform parents of their opinion about vaccinations, or whether they themselves are vaccinated.
The authors of the study concluded that the nurses who do the vaccinations are, in fact, anti-vaccinations. (Israel)

This is probably the most important study of all presented here. In almost all other studies, data was collected from surveys of doctors. Doctors perfectly understand that they should not negatively react about vaccinations, therefore it is logical to assume that the real number of doctors who do not vaccinate their children is much higher. The data in this study is real, they are not based on surveys. 98% of nurses whose main role is to vaccinate children refuse to be vaccinated themselves!
Israeli doctors, however, also [refuse==https://www.vesty.co.il/articles/0,7340,L-5028846,00.html] to be vaccinated against the flu.

points.title: Influenza vaccination among healthcare workers in Italy.
points.digest: Health workers are refusing influenza vaccination, despite ten years of efforts to increase vaccination rates. Only 30% of doctors, 11% of nurses, and 9% of clinical staff have been vaccinated against the flu. (Italy)

points.title: Vaccinating health care workers during an influenza pandemic.
points.digest:
41% of healthcare workers refused to vaccinate against swine flu during the 2009 pandemic. They believed that the vaccine was ineffective, and there were side effects, and in general, this infection usually passes easily.
57% of healthcare workers refused to get vaccinated for regular flu. (London, Great Britain)

points.title: Influenza vaccination amongst hospital health care workers in Beijing.
points.digest:
Only 13% of doctors and 21% of nurses vaccinated against influenza.
40% of health care workers believe that flu vaccine can cause flu. (Beijing, China)

points.title: Seasonal and Pandemic A (H1N1) 2009 influenza vaccination coverage and attitudes among health-care workers in a Spanish University Hospital.
points.digest: More than half of health workers refused to be vaccinated against influenza, and only 16.5% were vaccinated against swine flu during the 2009 pandemic. They doubted the effectiveness of the vaccination and were afraid of side effects. (Madrid, Spain)

points.title: Influenza vaccination compliance among health care workers in a German university hospital.
points.digest: For more than 20 years, German health care workers have been pushed to be vaccinated for influenza, but only 39% of doctors and 17% of nurses are vaccinated. They are afraid of side effects, believe that vaccination can lead to illness, and do not believe in its effectiveness. (Berlin, Germany)

points.title: Influenza vaccination attitudes and practices among US registered nurses.
points.digest: 41% of nurses are not vaccinated against the flu. They were afraid of side effects, they believed that the risk of infection was low, and in general, they did not consider this vaccine to be effective. (USA)

points.title: Skepticism towards Emerging Infectious Diseases and Influenza Vaccination Intentions in Nurses.
points.digest:
Swiss nurses are skeptical of infectious diseases and the vaccine against influenza.
Outbreaks of diseases are always less dangerous than announced by public health authorities and the media, reducing public confidence in the reliability of expert sources of information. Conflict of interest between public organizations and private corporations also reduces public confidence.

The same story is repeated in [Canada==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18448210], [Brazil==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17276792], [France==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23116695] [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/27919630] and in the rest of the world [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19467744] [[2]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16804657] Doctors and nurses in all countries refuse to be vaccinated against the flu. More: [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21956456]

Recent graduates of medical faculties less often believe that vaccines are the safest medicines, and that vaccines become better and safer. They are more resistant to compulsory vaccination, and they believe more that vaccination does more harm than good.
points.title: Are Recent Medical Graduates More Skeptical of Vaccines?

points.digest:
Lectures:
[Daniel Neides, MD - A Doctor's Perspective==https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vMJ6AaugP5w]

Australian doctors who [help==https://www.facebook.com/9NewsMelbourne/videos/1886631838267135] to their patients refuse vaccinations [are prosecuted==http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-08-24/melbourne-doctors-investigated-over-anti-vaccination-allegations/8837554]. [More==https://www.facebook.com/iwakeupwithtoday/videos/1711307558903902/].
Doctors in India who order many vaccines, [receive==http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/healthcare/biotech/pharmaceuticals/pharma-firm-lures-doctors-with-gold-coins-to-push -its-vaccines/articleshow/56700011.cms] gifts from a pharmaceutical company.
Here is an [example==https://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/judgment-reserved-in-tim-noakes-appeal-20180223] of a doctor who went on trial for recommending a low-carb diet on Twitter..

However much doctors and nurses push that all vaccinations are safe and effective, not all believe in it.
Scientific evidence suggests that the medical consensus on the safety and effectiveness of vaccinations is a myth.

Those who would give up essential Liberty to purchase a little temporary safety,

points.digest: How is the safety of vaccines tested? Randomized double-blind placebo-controlled studies are done, and they look at the side effects which arise for the people who received the vaccine, and compare them to the control group.

Clinical trials are very expensive, they cost tens of millions of dollars. Developing medicines costs hundreds of millions. But all of this is trivial for pharmaceutical companies. An FDA-licensed vaccination very quickly becomes part of the vaccination schedule of most countries, and yields billions in profit on an annual basis. For example, sales of one of the recently licensed vaccines, Gardasil (against HPV), [account for==https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-10-25/merck-beats-estimates-as-sales-of-gardasil-vaccine-surge] more than 3 billion per year.

Naturally, pharmaceutical companies want to lower the odds of unsuccessful clinical trials. But do they have a legal opportunity to do so?
It turns out they do, and it is very simple. Instead of a placebo, you just need to use something which is not a real placebo, but something sufficiently toxic, which leads to the same side effects as the vaccine being tested. One of the most toxic components of vaccines is aluminium (this is shown in another section), which is used as an adjuvant in most vaccines. If, instead of a placebo, aluminium is used, or, for example, aluminium with ethylmercury, or simply another vaccine, it is possible to increase the number of side effects in the control group, and then it will be comparable to the number of side effects in the group which received the new vaccine. Thus we conclude that the new vaccine has no side effects, and it is completely safe. On the basis of these data the FDA and CDC also conclude that the vaccine is safe, and then so do all the remaining countries.
Is this legal? Absolutely.

But in principle you don’t even have to agonize over the choice of placebo. It is by no means obligatory to use a placebo in randomized clinical vaccine studies. The studies don’t even have to be randomized or blind. You can simply give everyone the vaccination, and see what the side effects are. If the majority remains alive, it means that the vaccine is absolutely safe.
Here are two very interesting articles:

points.title: What's in placebos: who knows? Analysis of randomized, controlled trials.
points.digest:
Inert substances do not exist, and no norms exist for what a placebo must consist of. This, of course, affects the results of the studies.
There is no requirement to disclose the contents of placebo used in clinical trials. Medical journals do not require this information either.
The authors analysed 167 clinical studies, published in four of the most prestigious medical journals. Most of the clinical studies did not disclose the composition of the placebo. Only studies for 8% of pills and 26% of injections reported what was used as the placebo. For example, in the study on medication for anorexia associated with cancer, it was found that the medication positively affects the GIT. However, lactose was used as the placebo. Oncological patients who are undergoing chemo and radiation therapy usually have lactose intolerance, which resulted in the medication which did not contain lactose differing favorably from the “placebo”.

In 1930, two doctors from the German city of Lübeck decided to vaccinate children en masse against tuberculosis with the BCG vaccine which, although it had been available since 1921, had not really been used. In the 12 months of this campaign, 208 children contracted tuberculosis due to the vaccinations, and 77 died. The doctors were arrested and convicted of murder.
This led to discussion on the use of children in medical experiments. In 2008, the USA renounced the Declaration of Helsinki. (Instead, it uses Good Clinical Practice, which does not restrict pharmaceutical companies as much as the Declaration of Helsinki).
In vaccine studies it is possible to use saline (an isotonic solution), but researchers often choose other medicines. The article cites four examples:
In the study on a vaccine for pneumococcus (PCV9), another vaccine (DTP-Hib) was used as the placebo.
In the study on a vaccine for cholera, a vaccine for E. coli was used as the placebo.
In another study on a vaccine for pneumococcus (PCV23), vaccines for hepatitis A and B were used.
In a fourth study, aluminium hydroxide mixed with thiomersal (ethylmercury) was used as the placebo.
points.title: Testing vaccines in pediatric research subjects.

points.digest: Unlike the clinical trials for medicines, where the contents of the placebo are often concealed, many vaccine producers do not normally conceal the used placebo. In order to find out, you just need to read the vaccine inserts. Here are only a few examples.

[Daptacel==https://www.fda.gov/downloads/biologicsbloodvaccines/vaccines/approvedproducts/ucm103037.pdf], a vaccine for diphtheria, tetanus and whooping cough (DTaP, Sanofi Pasteur). Three vaccines were used as the placebo: DTP, DT and an experimental vaccine for whooping cough.
Yes, yes. An experimental vaccine was used as a placebo. Let that sink in.

[Infanrix==https://www.gsksource.com/pharma/content/dam/GlaxoSmithKline/US/en/Prescribing_Information/Infanrix/pdf/INFANRIX.PDF], another vaccine for diphtheria, tetanus and whooping cough  (DTaP, GlaxoSmithKline). The vaccine Pediarix was used as the placebo. In addition, both groups received these vaccines alongside vaccinations for hepatitis B, pneumococcus, chicken pox, polio, haemophilus influenzae, measles, mumps and rubella.

[Pediarix==https://www.gsksource.com/pharma/content/dam/GlaxoSmithKline/US/en/Prescribing_Information/Pediarix/pdf/PEDIARIX.PDF], a vaccine for diphtheria, tetanus, whooping cough, hepatitis B and polio (DTaP-HepB-IPV, GlaxoSmithKline). This vaccine was tested together with a vaccine for haemophilus influenzae. The control group received the vaccine Infanrix, as well as a vaccine for polio and haemophilus influenzae.

That is, roughly speaking, Pediarix was used as the placebo in the Infanrix trials, and Infanrix was used as the placebo in the Pediarix trials. All of this was seasoned with a blend of several other vaccines, in order to completely eradicate the possibility of distinguishing any side effects from the vaccine being tested.

The first vaccines for diphtheria, tetanus and whooping cough appeared long before anyone bothered with clinical trials or the use of placebos. Thus, here it can be argued that the use of a placebo to test them, i.e. not to vaccinate a portion of the children, is unethical. But even the clinical trials of new vaccines, against new diseases, use other vaccines as the placebo.

[Havrix==https://www.gsksource.com/pharma/content/dam/GlaxoSmithKline/US/en/Prescribing_Information/Havrix/pdf/HAVRIX.PDF], a vaccine for hepatitis A (GlaxoSmithKline) The clinical study included three groups. The first received Havrix. The second received Havrix + MMR (a vaccination against measles/mumps/rubella). The third received MMR + chicken pox, as well as Havrix after 42 days.

[Prevnar==https://www.fda.gov/downloads/biologicsbloodvaccines/vaccines/approvedproducts/ucm137038.pdf], pneumococcal vaccine (PCV7, Wyeth). The placebo was an experimental (!) meningococcal C vaccine.
The next version of this vaccine [Prevnar-13==https://www.fda.gov/downloads/biologicsbloodvaccines/vaccines/approvedproducts/ucm201669.pdf] (Pfizer) already used Prevnar as a placebo.

[Prevnar==https://www.fda.gov/downloads/biologicsbloodvaccines/vaccines/approvedproducts/ucm137038.pdf], a vaccine for pneumococcus (PCV7, Wyeth). An experimental(!) meningococcal C vaccine was used as the placebo. In the next version of this vaccine, [Prevnar-13==https://www.fda.gov/downloads/biologicsbloodvaccines/vaccines/approvedproducts/ucm201669.pdf] (Pfizer), Prevnar was already used as the placebo.

[Cervarix==https://www.fda.gov/downloads/biologicsbloodvaccines/vaccines/approvedproducts/ucm186981.pdf], human papillomavirus vaccine (GlaxoSmithKline). The placebo vaccine was a hepatitis A vaccine, as well as aluminum hydroxide.

[Cervarix==https://www.fda.gov/downloads/biologicsbloodvaccines/vaccines/approvedproducts/ucm186981.pdf], a vaccine for the human papillomavirus (GlaxoSmithKline). A vaccine for hepatitis A and aluminium hydroxide were used as the placebo.

[Engerix-B==https://www.gsksource.com/pharma/content/dam/GlaxoSmithKline/US/en/Prescribing_Information/Engerix-B/pdf/ENGERIX-B.PDF], a vaccine for hepatitis B (GlaxoSmithKline). There was no control group.
[Recombivax==http://www.merck.com/product/usa/pi_circulars/r/recombivax_hb/recombivax_pi.pdf],  a vaccine for hepatitis B (Merck). There was no control group.

[MMR-II==https://www.fda.gov/downloads/BiologicsBloodVaccines/UCM123789.pdf], a vaccine for measles, mumps and rubella. There was no control group. Indeed, no clinical safety studies were done for this vaccine.

In order to license a new vaccine, it is quite enough for the FDA for it not to be more dangerous than any other vaccine, whether an experimental vaccine, or aluminium hydroxide, or any other substance, which the pharmaceutical company is not obligated to disclose.
In clinical studies for vaccines, a real, inactive placebo is virtually never used.
So next time someone claims that vaccines are completely safe, ask them in comparison to what they are completely safe.
Vaccines are only completely safe compared to other vaccines, or compared to extremely toxic substances.

epigraph.text: If you see fraud and do not say fraud, you are a fraud.

points.digest: We have already worked out that safety of vaccines is tested without the real placebo, but only in the comparison to other vaccine, or in comparison with some other toxic compound. But this is not all. There are a few more problems with testing vaccines’ safety.

First of all, nearly all of trials are done exclusively on healthy children, which does not stop manufacturers, FDA and CDC to recommend the inoculation to not so healthy children, premature babies, and not only children, but also children of a younger age.

Secondly, nearly all clinical trials of safety are looking only for the short-term effects. Usually, they last from several days to several weeks. There are rarely trials that last several months. All of side effects, which happen after this period, a-priory can not be related to the inoculation.

Thirdly, even if there are serious adverse effects occurring during the trial, scientists can decide that those adverse effects, or even death, are not related to the inoculation and can cross them out without taking into account.

Fourthly, research is usually done on relatively small groups of children. For example, Hepatitis B vaccine [was tested==https://www.fda.gov/downloads/biologicsbloodvaccines/vaccines/approvedproducts/ucm110114.pdf] on 147 newborns. Usually, vaccines are tested on children from third world countries, which halves the costs for clinical trials. Often, children and parents in the third world countries [do not know==http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2893485/Children-guinea-pigs-anti-cervical-cancer-drug.html] that they are receiving an experimental vaccine. [[1]==http://www.buenosairesherald.com/article/88922/gsk-lab-fined-$1m-over-tests-that-killed-14-babies] [[2]==https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O7BxnC6EUuo]

Here is an [example==https://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT00662870] of clinical trials of Daptacel vaccine. To take part in the trial a child should be absolutely healthy, born after the 37th week, not sensitive to any of the vaccine components, without developmental delays, the family should not have a history of immune diseases, and so on. More or less the same requirements are stated for all other vaccine trials. That is, in comparison to medicines, which are usually tested on ill patients and are then given to ill patient, vaccines are tested exclusively on healthy children and are then given to both, healthy and not so healthy children, and even very ill children.

This is an article, that reports about the results of the study, which is mentioned above:
Safety was tested for 30 and 60 days after each dose.
In 5.2% children from the test group, and, also, in 5.2% from the control group (which received 3 different inoculations) serious adverse effects were noticed. Scientists decided that these adverse effects were not related to the inoculation. Authors did not report what adverse effects there were and why they were excluded.

A few more examples:

Safety and immunogenicity of a modified process hepatitis B vaccine in healthy infants.

Clinical trials of the Recombivax-HB vaccine, against Hepatitis B. It’s safety was tested throughout 14 days.
77% of children had adverse events. 28 children (1.6%) had serious adverse events. One child died (SIDS). Authors report that probably his death was not related to the vaccination.

points.digest:
Clinical trials of Comvax vaccine, against haemophilus influenzae and Hepatitis B. Safety was tested throughout 14 days.
Serious adverse events occurred in 17 babies (1.9%). 3 children died (SIDS). Scientists concluded that all serious adverse events were not related to the vaccine.

points.title: Safety, reactogenicity and immunogenicity of the combined hexavalent tetanus, diphtheria, acellular pertussis, hepatitis B, inactivated poliovirus vaccine and Haemophilus influenzae type b conjugate vaccine, for primary immunization of infants.
points.digest:
Clinical trials of Infanrix hexa vaccine. Safery was tested during 30 days.
Serious adverse events occurred in 79 babies (2.7%). Nearly all of them were not related to the vaccine. One child died (SIDS). It was not related to the inoculation.

points.title: Randomized, Controlled, Multicenter Study of the Immunogenicity and Safety of a Fully Fluid Liquid Combination Diphtheria-Tetanus Toxoid-Five-Component Acellular Pertussis (DTaP5), Inactivated Poliovirus (IPV), and Haemophilus influenzae Type b (Hib) Vaccine Compared with a DTaP3-IPV/ Hib Vaccine Administered at 3, 5, and 12 Months of Age.
points.digest: Clinical trials of pentavalent vaccines: Safety was checked within 30 days. 8.5% of infants had serious adverse events, almost no vaccines were associated.

points.title: Immunogenicity, Safety, and Tolerability of a Hexavalent Vaccine in Infants.
points.digest:
Clinical trials of hexavalent vaccine. Safety was tested for 6 months.
84 babies (5.9%) had adverse events. Two died. No relation to the vaccine.

This is, more or less, how majority of safety trials look. They are rarely longer than a few days or weeks. Most of the time they have serious adverse events occurring in absolutely healthy children during this short period of time, and they are rarely happen to be related to the inoculation. They are not related because in the control group, which receives a different vaccine or the same vaccines without an antigen, same events are registered. In these short clinical trials it is impossible to find autoimmune, oncological or neurological diseases, as well as many other diseases, which are not rare results of inoculations (it will be proven later), but that are not possible to be diagnosed earlier than a few months or a few years after vaccination.
Moreover, vaccine inserts always state that there were no trials of carcinogenicity of the medicine, mutagenecity and its possible effect on reproductive system.

In fact, in order for a child to be able to participate in clinical trials, he needs to be fully vaccinated with other vaccines. This is done in order to weed out very sensitive children, which have a tendency to become autistic, disabled or generally unhealthy after vaccination.

epigraph.text: If you are not doing something controversial, you are not doing something important.

points.digest: One of the procedures that almost every child undergoes immediately after birth in most developed countries is the injection of vitamin K. Vitamin K plays an important role in the process of blood clotting, and it is believed that its deficiency can lead to hemorrhagic disease of newborns VKDB).

Vitamin K was discovered in the early 1930s when a Danish biochemist discovered that chickens who were fed a low-fat and cholesterol-free diet developed subcutaneous and intramuscular hemorrhages. The vitamin was called the letter K from the word "koagulation"
Vitamin K1 is found in leafy green vegetables such as spinach, chard, turnip, cabbage (also colored, Brussels, kale), in some fruits (avocado, banana, kiwi), and in some vegetable oils. Vitamin K2 is synthesized by many species intestinal bacteria, but this is most likely not particularly important. The recommended IOM daily dose of the vitamin is 120 mcg for men and 90 mcg for women. In Europe, the recommended dose is significantly lower. The recommended dose for infants is 2 mcg/day. Breast milk contains 1-4 mcg. There are 3 types of hemorrhagic disease of the newborn (which since 1999 is called VKDB - Vitamin K deficiency bleeding).
1) Early (in the first 24 hours after birth). It is observed almost exclusively in infants whose mothers took medicines that inhibit vitamin K (anticonvulsant and anti-tuberculosis drugs, some [antibiotics==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/2276882], coumarin, etc.). It is observed in 6-12% (among those taking medication) and usually it is difficult.
2) Classical (24 hours - 7 days after birth). Associated with malnutrition. Observed in 0.25-1.5% (according to old data) and 0-0.44% (according to new data), and usually passes easily. Includes bleeding from the umbilical cord, as well as bleeding after circumcision or injection.
3) Late (2-12 weeks after birth). Associated with exclusive breastfeeding (BF) (since vitamin K is added to children's mixtures) and [linked to==http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4862383] malabsorption of vitamin K due to liver disease, and with insufficient intake of vitamin. The incidence of not receiving vitamin K children on an exclusive BF is 1 per 15-20,000. Passes hard (20% mortality and frequent neurological consequences).
The obvious paradox in homeostasis in newborns is that coagulation tests do not indicate bleeding. Today it is clear to us that the physiology of hemostasis in childhood differs significantly from the physiology of adults. Studies in humans and animals indicate that the coefficients of coagulation in newborns differ from adults quantitatively, but not qualitatively. [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18175287] [[2]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17510751]
The system of hemostasis is fully formed at the age of 3-6 months. Therefore, it is important to recognize that the differences between adults and infants are probably physiological, and do not always indicate a pathology. Both oral and intramuscular administration of vitamin K protects against the classical form of VKDB. However, one oral dose does not protect all infants from late VKDB.

Even in developed countries, there is little accurate data on the prevalence of classical VKDB. Classic VKDB: One study showed a reduction in the risk of bleeding due to injection by 27%, and serious bleeding by 81%. Another study showed a reduction in bleeding after circumcision by 82%.

Oral intake of a vitamin is less expensive and has no theoretical risk of mutagenicity.

points.title: Are breast-fed infants vitamin K deficient?
points.digest: Breast milk contains very little vitamin K (~1 μg/l), but if the mother consumes more than 1 μg/kg/day during pregnancy and lactation, this significantly increases the level of vitamin K in milk (up to 80 μg/l) and in the blood plasma of the baby. points.title: Vitamin K1 content of maternal milk: the influence of the stage of lactation, lipid composition, and vitamin K1 supplements given to the mother.
points.digest: The concentration of vitamin K in the rear milk is higher than in the front milk, which is not surprising, since it is known that the rear milk is more fat. The concentration of vitamin K in the colostrum is higher than in the mature milk, and correlates with the level of cholesterol. The addition of vitamin K to the diet of mothers (0.5-3 mg) significantly increased the concentration of vitamin K in milk.

(High bilirubin is a jaundice of newborns.) points.digest:
The probability of bleeding in infants not belonging to the risk group is 1 per 10,000. Among those who received the injection, the probability of bleeding is 1 per million. In this study, cancer (mainly leukemia) was associated with intramuscular injection of vitamin K (OR=1.44, CI: 1.00-2.08) Children who were diagnosed before the 12-month-old age were excluded from the study. points.title: Observations on vitamin K deficiency in the fetus and newborn: has made by mistake?
points.digest:
The fetus of mammals and bird embryos has a significantly lower level of vitamin K than adults, and it's unclear why a normal newborn enters the outside world in a state that requires immediate intervention. The question why even adults do not have excess vitamin K , also remains unanswered.
[Benzopyrene==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benzo(a)pyrene] is a carcinogen for mice. In mice on a diet with a low level of vitamin K, tumors after the administration of this drug developed much more slowly than in mice on a normal diet.
In mice injected with vitamin K in addition to benzapyrene, the tumors developed faster.
When mice were given only vitamin K, without benzapyrine, the tumors did not develop.
The authors suggest that a low level of vitamin K the fetus is a secondary defense mechanism against [xenobiotics==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xenobiotic] that pass through the placenta.

Sometimes it happens that instead of vitamin K the baby is injected [methylergometrine==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Methylergometrine] This is a psychedelic alkaloid that is used to prevent bleeding after childbirth, it is confused with vitamin K because they have similar ampoules, and all of the babies who received it orally survived, and among those who received it with injection, mortality was 7.5%. [1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16041632/] [[2]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/27765939/] [[3]==https ://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20972685] [[4]==http://pediatrics.aappublications.org/content/98/3/457.long] [ [5]==http://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/000992287101000505] [[6]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11590951/] [[7]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20044369/]
Until 1999 [it was considered==https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/1467-8519.00129] that children begin to experience pain after reaching 12 months of age.

For many years, doctors in the US have not considered pain in infants as one of the risks or disadvantages in making treatment decisions. Surface observations showed that painkillers have some risks, and babies seem to still forget about pain, because if the patient does not come back with pain complaints, which can be particularly important?
However, studies in the 1990s revealed that pain experienced in infancy has long-term consequences: for example, babies who have been circumcised without lidocaine ointment suffered from pain during vaccination more than those cut off with lidocaine, which in turn suffered more than uncircumcised.
In newborn rats, which for some time were separated from the mother, suppression of the immune system was observed, and they were more
In rats, who were injected endotoxin in infancy, in adulthood there was an acute reaction to stress, increased susceptibility to metastases, and delayed healing of wounds, which indicates an inability to form a The rat pups, who were pained by puncture in the paw, showed increased pain sensitivity in adolescence. In adulthood, they showed great anxiety, social over-alertness, and they had a craving for alcohol.
In prematurely born infants (who were much more exposed to painful medical procedures than those born on time), pain sensitivity was reduced.
In infants with multiple birth trauma, the risk of violent suicide was 4.9 times higher in men and 4% higher in women. But if the mother received opioids during childbirth, the risk of suicide was 31% lower for both sexes than for those born without trauma. The authors conclude that although people do not remember the early painful events, they are recorded somewhere in body. Numerous medical procedures to which infants are exposed, from prick to heel to circumcision, can alter a child's development. Children's pain should be avoided whenever possible, and if necessary, treats it as closely as pain in adults. Doctors and parents should realize that the pain should be added to the list of risks for making a decision about treatment, and for consent to the procedures to which the baby is exposed. This consideration was not part of the traditional decision-making model for most physicians.
points.title: Are There Long-Term Consequences of Pain in Newborn or Very Young Infants?
Iatrogenic pain in newborns as a risk factor for chronic pain syndromes.
points.digest: Frequent painful irritations in newborns, especially premature babies, lead to central sensitization of those areas of the cerebral cortex that make up the leading part of the neuroimatrix of pain and are responsible for the sensory, affective and cognitive components of pain perception. Central sensitization and dysfunction of systems that regulate pain sensitivity, as is known, leads to the formation of chronic pain syndromes.

points.title: Delayed cord clamping in very preterm infants, the incidence of intraventricular hemorrhage and late-onset sepsis: a randomized, controlled trial.
points.digest: If you do not cut the umbilical cord immediately after birth, and wait at least 30-40 seconds, the risk of [intraventricular hemorrhage==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intraventricular_hemorrhage] and sepsis is significantly reduced.

The late form of hemorrhagic disease of newborns is a new disease that was described in 1985 and is observed only in children on exclusive BF. Breast milk in industrialized countries is contaminated [polychlorinated biphenyls==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polychlorinated_biphenyl] (PCBs), [polychlorinated dibenzo-p-dioxins==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polychlorinated_dibenzodioxins] (PCDD) and polychlorinated dibenzofurans (PCDF). Xenobiotics were found in the milk of Dutch mothers, but they were not found in the milk of a woman who recently migrated from Suriname to a woman who had immigrated from Suriname 15 years ago xenobiotics were also found. It is known that PCB, PCDD and PCDF cause liver enlargement, increased blood clotting time, cirrhosis of the liver and t Clinical symptoms of infants whose mothers were poisoned by these substances included a slowing of growth, a smaller circumference of the head, [hirsutism==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hirsutism], etc. Those who were breast-fed with breast milk containing PCBs were observed, among other things, fatigue, anorexia, abdominal pain, vomiting and eczema. Monkeys were found fatty liver, atrophy of the pancreas and hemorrhage in the digestive tract after a high dose. Millions of chickens that die due to contaminated food experience subepicardial bleeding. In mice, the wolf mouth, bleeding and subcutaneous edema are observed. The authors have checked the level of dioxins in the milk of 14 mothers. The mothers of 4 babies who had bleeding had a significantly higher dioxin level than the other 10 mothers. The authors believe that there is probably a cause-and-effect relationship between PCBs, dioxins and furans in breast milk and late hemorrhagic disease. These xenobiotics may also be associated with prolonged jaundice in newborns. epigraph.text: The remedy is worse than the disease.

points.digest: Meningococcus is the third kind of bacteria that causes meningitis and bacteremia. The incidence of meningococcal infection is much lower than the incidence of pneumococcal and hemophilic infection, but since the meningococcal vaccine is the newest licensed vaccine, meningococcus has recently become the biggest scary.

There are 13 serogroups of meningococcus, but for invasive infections there are mainly five: A, B, C, W, Y. 60% of invasive infections in children are caused by serogroup B. Lethality of invasive infection is 10-15% , and the lethality of meningococcemia (meningococcal sepsis) reaches 40%.
Risk factors are active and passive smoking, alcohol, tightness and aspiration (absence of spleen). 98% of cases are sporadic, and only 2% are due to outbreaks .
The first polysaccharide vaccine appeared in 1974. Like other policies it is not effective for infants.

The first conjugate vaccine for meningococcus (Menactra) was licensed in 2005 for adolescents over the age of 11. The second vaccine (Menveo) was licensed in 2010. Both protect against serogroups ACWY, that the vaccines will be effective for 10 years, but later it turned out that the number of antibodies is reduced in 3-5 years, and those vaccinated at 11 years old will not be protected at 16-21 years, when the risk of meningococcal infection is higher. Therefore, in 2010, revaccination was added at 16 years.
In 2006-10, 30 cases of disease in vaccinated people were registered in the CDC. The lethality among them was the same as that of the unvaccinated.

Two vaccines from serogroup B-Bexsero (GSK) and Trumenba (Pfizer) were licensed in 2014-15, but they were not added to the vaccination schedule yet.

points.digest:
The incidence of meningococcal infection is 1 per 300,000 in the US, and an average of 1 per 100,000 in Europe. It used to be the case that the highest incidence is in children from 6-24 months, that infants up to 6 months old do not get antibodies from their mother.
Polysaccharide vaccines against serogroups ACWY are not effective for infants.
Most cases occur in serogroup B, but since the capsule of this serogroup contains a molecule that very similar to glycoprotein in the brain, polysaccharide vaccines from this serogroup, first, poorly produce antibodies, and secondly, can lead to an autoimmune reaction due to the mechanism of molecular mimicry. Therefore, vaccines based on outer membrane proteins have been developed.But since the proteins of the outer membrane membranes of meningococcus can [change==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antigenic_shift] antigens, this can lead to ineffectiveness of the vaccine.
Because meningococcal infection is a very rare disease, all vaccines t meningococcus were licensed solely on the basis of immunogenicity (ie antibody levels), and not on the basis of clinical efficacy.
points.title: Advances in the development of vaccines against Neisseria meningitidis.

points.digest:
Between 1998 and 2007, the incidence of meningococcal infection declined by 64%, on average over the years, the incidence was 1 per 200 thousand, and by 2007 the incidence of meningococcus decreased to 1 per 300 thousand.
The highest incidence was among infants less than a year (5 per 100,000), 50% of cases are caused by serogroup B. Two thirds of cases in the first year of life occur among infants younger than 6 months.
Blacks are 44% more likely than white. Mortality of meningococcal infection was 11%, and increased with age. The ratio was 24%, and among infants 3-6%.
Most cases were observed in January and February, and less in August.
The authors conclude that before the vaccination began, the incidence of meningococcal infection in the US was at historical the minimum, and that after the start of vaccination there was no significant reduction in the incidence in adolescents who were vaccinated, because only 32% were vaccinated.
(The motif, which runs the red thread in almost all studies. If after the start of vaccination there was no reduction in the incidence - then this is because the coverage was inadequate. And if there was a decrease, then, of course, this is due to vaccination, even if only 2% were vaccinated).
points.title: Changes in Neisseria meningitidis disease epidemiology in the United States, 1998-2007: implications for the prevention of meningococcal disease.

points.digest: The lethality of meningococcal infection in Scotland fell from 10.3% in 1946-61 to 1.2% in 1971-86. The incidence decreased from 7.9 to 5.3 per 100,000 children. The incidence of hemophilic infection increased 4-fold during this time, while the mortality rate fell from 19.2% to 3%.

Human immunity to the meningococcus, II. Development of natural immunity.
points.digest:
As a result of asymptomatic colonization by meningococcus, antibodies are produced from it within a few weeks.
Infants are protected by antibodies to the mother up to half a year.The concentration of antibodies in the blood in infants is higher than in the mother's blood.
Usually natural immunity is developed in childhood.

10% of the population are carriers of meningococcal bacteria, of which less than 3% of children are infected, and 24-37% are infected between 15-24 years old. A high level of colonization is also observed in the army, for example, among Norwegian soldiers, more than 70% meningococcus.
A recent study showed that the number of meningococcal carriers, which is determined by conventional methods (bacussis), may be underestimated Using another method (immunohistochemistry), it was found that 45% were meningococcal carriers, while only 10% had meningococcus Colonization of meningococcus leads to the production of antibodies within a few weeks after infection, and can protect against disease.
Approximately 50% of the strains found in carriers were found to be non-encapsulating. Previously, it was thought that the noncapsular strains were not pathogenic, but then it turned out that meningococci know how to turn capsules on and off at a high frequency, and there is evidence that the loss of the capsule enhances the ability of meningococci to colonize the nasopharynx and avoid the body's defense system. The risk of meningococcal disease in travelers and current recommendations for prevention.

Outbreaks of meningococcal disease often occurred among pilgrims in Mecca, so Saudi Arabia imposed mandatory vaccinations for those wishing to obtain a Hajj visa.
After that, outbreaks were [not observed==https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1201971216310207].
Meningococcal disease is most common in the "African meningitis belt", which includes countries in sub-Saharan Africa, most of which are recorded in the dry season. Nevertheless, there is not a single known case of a tourist disease
Every 6 weeks CDC investigates potential th meningococcal infection in the aircraft. However, only two such cases are known.

points.title: Tobacco smoke as a risk factor for meningococcal disease.
points.digest:
The risk of meningococcal infection in a child under 18 increases by 3.8 times if his mother smokes.
Among adults, smoking increases the risk of meningococcal infection by 2.4 times, passive smoking by 2.5 times, and chronic disease by 10.8 time.

points.title: Second hand smoke exposure and the risk of invasive meningococcal disease in children: systematic review and meta-analysis.
points.digest:
Passive smoking increases the risk of meningococcal infection by 2.2 times. When both parents smoke, the risk rises by a factor of 8. More: [[1]==https://academic.oup.com/ije/article/35/2/330/694745] [[2]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/2570968] [[3]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2998445/]
In Ghana, where meningococcal meningitis is much more common than in developed countries, cooking on wood-fired ovens [increases==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11706652] the risk of disease is 9 times.

If parents only smoke outside the home, this does not reduce the level of nicotine in the hair in children, which may indicate that smokers continue to exhale nicotine after smoking. This hints that the risk of meningococcal infection will not go down if to ban smoking only in some places like houses, cars and hospitals, and a total ban is needed. But it is known that relatively few people quit smoking, so the vaccination of children will probably be more effective. In addition, there is hope that children can save from meningococcus also of their smoking parents through collective immunity.
points.title: Passive smoking, invasive meningococcal disease and preventive measures: a commentary.
Increased Risk for Meningococcal Disease Among Men Who Have Sex With Men in the United States, 2012-2015.
points.digest:
The risk of meningococcal infection among homosexuals is 4 times higher than that of heterosexuals. HIV-infected homosexuals have a 10-fold higher risk of meningococcal disease than uninfected homosexuals. 45% of meningococcal cases reported numerous partners and participation in anonymous sex.
Among homosexuals, 32% smoke (compared to 18% of adults in the US), and 48% use drugs (compared to 10% on average).
In New York, the risk of meningococcal infection among homosexuals was 50 times [higher==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3962794/] than, on average, in German and 13 times [above==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3962794/], in Paris 10 times [above==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih .gov/pmc/articles/PMC3962794/], in Southern California 50 times [higher==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3962794/]. 24% of homosexuals are carriers of meningococcus compared with 6% among heterosexual women, among the homosexuals who recently had oral-anal contact, 43% were carriers.
Meningococcus was also [detected==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/411836] in 4.5% of homosexuals in the anal channel. In 2016 there was a [discovered==http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4864352/] a new strain of meningococcus that can be transmitted sexually.
CDC [reports==https://www.cdc. gov/meningococcal/downloads/NCIRD-EMS-Report.pdf] that in 2016, 57% of those meningococcal men over 16 years of age reported having a homosexual contact. More: [[1]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26562570] [[2]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23870095] [[3]==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/411836] [[4]==https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/mm6151a4.htm].

HIV infection increases the risk of meningococcal infection 11-fold, and AIDS 12-fold. In 2010, a new outbreak of meningococcus among homosexuals began in New York City, due to mobile dating applications and visits to gay bars.

Outbreak of meningococcus at the University of Ohio (13 cases.) Visiting bars was associated with an 8-fold increase in the risk of the disease, and kissing more than one partner at 13.6.
In Chile, risk factors for meningococcal infection [were==https://wwwnc.cdc.gov/eid/article/23/7/16-0129_article] tightness (more than 2.5 people in the bedroom), low mother education, low income, alcohol abuse and chronic illness.

points.title: Effectiveness of meningococcal serogroup C conjugate vaccine 4 years after introduction.
points.digest: In 1999, a conjugate vaccine was introduced in England from meningococcus (serogroup C) into the national vaccination schedule for babies at the age of 2, 3 and 4 months. The effectiveness of the vaccine in the first year after vaccination was 93%, but after a year the effectiveness became negative (-81%). Immunity after vaccination at a later age persists longer.

points.title: Effect of the outer membrane vesicle vaccine against the group B meningococcal disease in Norway.
points.digest: Norway has the highest incidence of meningococcal infection in Europe, and 80% of cases occur in serogroup B. It was a double-blind, randomized trial (170,000 people) with an external membrane protein (OMV) vaccine was used as a placebo. The efficacy of the vaccine was only 57%, so it was decided not to be included in the vaccination schedule.

points.digest: A clinical trial of a vaccine against serogroup B in Chile (40,000 people). As a placebo, a vaccine for other serogroups of meningococcus was used. The effectiveness of the vaccine for 2.5 years was 51%, and among children under 5 years, the efficacy was negative -23%.

points.title: Antibody persistence following MeNZB vaccination of adults and children and response to a fourth dose in toddlers.
points.digest:
In 1991, a new epidemic of meningococcal serogroup B began in New Zealand. In 2001, it reached its peak and declined. A special vaccine for the New Zealand strain was developed by 2004. Since randomized trials during the epidemic was considered unethical, in 2004, a vaccination campaign was launched for all children from the 6th week of age to 19. By the year 80, 80% of children were vaccinated and the campaign was terminated.
7 months after the third dose of the vaccine , the number of antibodies in infants returned almost to the first. More: [[1]==http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid =10522985]
A detailed journalistic investigation of this campaign: [[ 1]==http://www.scoop.co.nz/stories/HL0502/S00064.htm] [[2]==http://www.scoop.co.nz/stories/HL0505/S00352.htm]

points.title: High Risk for Invasive Meningococcal Disease Among Patients Receiving Eculizumab (Soliris) Despite Receipt of Meningococcal Vaccine.
points.digest:
Eculizumab is a cure for very rare diseases, which suppresses [the complement system==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Complement_system] (one of the components of the congenital immune system). This medicine is associated with an increased risk of a meningococcal infection 1000-2000 times.
16 people using this medication got meningococcemia, 14 of them were vaccinated.

[Factor H==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Factor_H] is one of the proteins that regulate the complement system. Being attached to the cell, factor H inhibits the response of the complement system against this cell, and in an unattached form it intensifies the same reaction against microorganisms. If the bacterium has a protein capable of binding itself to factor H, then the bacterium can avoid the attack of the complement system.This mechanism is part of the virulence of some bacteria, including meningococcus.
Since the previous types of meningococcal vaccine serogroup B (polysaccharide, conjugated and outer membrane protein vaccines) were ineffective, new vaccines (Beksero and Trumanba) were [added==https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/pubs/pinkbook/supplement.html#ch14-mening] protein binding factor H, in the hope that this will lead to higher efficacy. Antibodies produced after vaccination with Bexero in animals were cross reactive with human factor H. At this time, it is not known whether antibodies are produced against H factor in humans, and whether this will increase the risk of an autoimmune reaction. cross-reactive with factor H, can also lead to suppression of the complement system, which is [key==https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3916388/] in the suppression of meningococcal disease by the body).

epigraph.text: The great tragedy of Science is the slaying of a beautiful hypothesis by an ugly fact.

points.digest:
Billions of people have been vaccinated with BCG since 1921, more than any other vaccine, but BCG is no less controversial than any other vaccine, its effectiveness has been debated so far and varies in various tests from zero up to 80% BCG are considered one of the safest vaccines, but the true statistics of such post-vaccination complications as BCG-it (lymphadenitis) and BCG-osteomyelitis are unknown.
Because of concerns about the efficacy and safety of BCG, to this day have been developed and examined on animals almost 200 new vaccines against tuberculosis, but only one of them showed better results than BCG, and it was a recombinant form of BCG itself.
Tuberculosis is caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis, but the vaccine contains Mycobacterium bovis, which causes tuberculosis in cows. This is because Calmette and Guerin, who named the vaccine, developed it initially for cattle, and not for humans. To this day, it is not known how important it is that the vaccine is based on M. bovis, and not on M. tuberculosis.
Calmette added bile to the culture of bacteria, so that they do not They fell and noticed that after a few months the bacterium became less virulent for guinea pigs. He continued to attenuate the bacterium in the presence of bile for 13 years, changing the nutrient medium every two weeks.
Since 1921, BCG has also begun to be done to humans. But since at that time the bacteria could not be freeze dry, they continued to be weakened in the same way and continued until 1961, changing the substrate every two weeks.
Calmette reported a decrease in virulence after 15 passages, and an even larger weakening after 215 passages. Was the bacterium weakened even more by 1961, after 1,173 passages, is unknown, since neither the original bacteria nor the original BCG of 1921 have survived.
Since 1924, BCG have begun to spread to laboratories in other countries that have continued to weaken the bacteria by that the same scheme and with the same goal - to prevent the return of virulence, while maintaining efficiency. So in different countries, BCG daughter strains were formed, which are called at the place of the laboratory (BCG Russia, Tokyo, Denmark, etc.). At present, BCG strains are prepared from lyophilized bacterial stocks that are re-suspended (added back to water) before vaccination. In most BCG vaccines, 90-95% of bacteria are dead, but in BCG Tokyo, 25% of bacteria are live. The importance of the proportion of live bacteria in the vaccine has not yet been studied. For example, do dead bacteria compensate the living? Science does not yet know the answer to this question.
What is important for a weakened vaccine is the presence of antigens in the absence of virulence. But it is known that certain strains of BCG lost antigens compared to the original bacterium. Loss of antigens is obviously undesirable, and it should be studied.
In an experiment in Czechoslovakia, the BCG-Prague strain was changed to BCG-Russia. The incidence of disseminated tuberculosis, including BCG osteitis due to vaccination, was higher in the Russian strain.
In the 1970s there was an epidemic of BCG osteitis in Sweden and in Finland, after which Finland switched to another strain, and Sweden canceled vaccination.
Have the strains of BCG changed during this time? Certainly. Is it important? Watching who to ask. The bacteriologist will be surprised if BCG has not changed significantly over half a century of cultivation in the laboratory. An official planning to vaccinate millions of babies needs more information. Is there the most effective strain of BCG? Or is it the safest? Do they differ? The answers to these questions, unfortunately, are still unknown.
Regardless of whether a certain strain of BCG will be used in the future, its genetically modified version, or an entirely new vaccine, let's hope that manufacturers will conduct clinical trials of the vaccine so that we again did not remain with the uncertainty of vaccinating millions of babies every year, without a clear understanding of its risks and benefits.

points.title: Is the development of a new tuberculosis vaccine possible?
points.digest:
Unfortunately, today we are no closer to eliminating or even controlling tuberculosis than we were when Koch first discovered mycobacteria. Despite the fact that the theoretical effectiveness of the vaccine was established in a meta-analysis of 50% , it is estimated that only 5% of tuberculosis deaths could be prevented by vaccination, therefore BCG is an unsatisfactory vaccine. In the case of tuberculosis, vaccinologists have to face a difficult obstacle - to develop a vaccine that is superior to the pathogen in relation to the immune response.
Given that T cells play a central role in protecting against tuberculosis, a future vaccine should influence T-lymphocytes, unfortunately, this is not a precedent, since all successful vaccines work through antibodies and not through T- cells.
Imagine the following scenario: a well-known researcher in the field of tuberculosis claims to have developed a therapeutic vaccine for tuberculosis that successfully works on animals.Thanks to the reputation of the scientist, the state immediately initiates a controlled clinical trial tions involving 2000 patients, and the results are known within 6 months. The pharmaceutical company gets a license for the vaccine, which makes the researcher a millionaire. This happened in the period from August 1890, when Robert Koch, told a medical congress that he had found a cure for tuberculosis until February 1891, when the official clinical trial report was published . Only 2% were cured. We can not again risk such a fiasco, and therefore it is appropriate to ask whether the task of developing an anti-tuberculosis vaccine is too complicated even today.

points.title: Mother-to-newborn transmission of mycobacterial L-forms and Vδ2 T-cell response in the placenta of BCG-vaccinated pregnant women.
points.digest:
Until recently, it was believed that the uterus was sterile, and that the child was born sterile, but the latest data disproved this paradigm.It was found that the placenta is colonized by non-pathogenic bacteria, and has its own microbiome (placentobium), which performs metabolic functions, which differs in premature and full-term children.
[L-form==https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/L-form_bacteria] - these are bacteria that are devoid of the cell wall, but have retained the ability to develop.In the BCG vaccine, L-shaped bacteria are found that are able to multiply and to form colonies.
In this study it was found that mothers vaccinated in infancy from tuberculosis transmit their L-forms of BCG bacteria through their placenta to their newly born children.Bacteria were found in the placenta and in cord blood in infants of 85% of vaccinated mothers , and infection occurs in the early stages of pregnancy (in the first trimester).
These bacteria can again return to their original form, and become ordinary mycobacteria.
Recent studies also indicate that L-form is an independent form of life , them They can multiply infinitely. They are an alternative form of bacterial life. It is not known exactly how long the bacteria of bovine tuberculosis BCG live in the vaccinated person. BCG bacteria were found in AIDS patients many years after vaccination.
Recent studies have shown that the transformation of bacteria into L-forms can often lead to chronic infections, since L-forms are dormant for a long time in tissues.
Despite for a large number of published literature on L-forms, doctors neglect them because of the difficulty of identifying them, despite the fact that they can cause latent, chronic and recurrent infections, as well as diseases of an unknown infectious-allergic or autoimmune origin tion.

points.title: The effect of revaccination with BCG in early childhood on mortality: a randomized trial in Guinea-Bissau.
points.digest:
The impact of vaccines on the survival of children in developing countries is not tested in randomized trials prior to their use, and it is assumed that the vaccine's effect on mortality is proportional to its effectiveness and the contribution of the disease to overall mortality. Studies of the last 15 years have shown that this assumption is not since vaccines have nonspecific effects, measles and bcg vaccines, for example, are associated with a decrease in mortality, while the vaccine against diphtheria, tetanus and pertussis (DTP), or a vaccine with high measles titers is associated with an increase in mortality.
The authors investigated the effectiveness of BCG revaccination in Guinea-Bissau, and the study was interrupted, as mortality in the vaccinated group was increased 2.7-fold. The authors believe that this was due to not the BCG itself, but with the DTP vaccine, to which BCG is somehow adversely affected, and with the additives of iron and vitamin A that the children received during the experiment.

The addition of vitamin A, iron and zinc enhances both the detrimental effect of DTP and the beneficial effect of BCG.

Tuberculosis II: the failure of the BCG vaccine.
points.digest:
The rapid increase in the incidence of tuberculosis corresponds to the period of industrialization, urbanization and poverty prevalent in Europe at that time. The tuberculosis bacterium (Koch's bacillus) was discovered by Koch in 1882 initially at risk of tuberculosis. and the first candidate for the vaccine was tuberculin. After 55 people from the first 1979 vaccinated patients died, work in this direction was stopped.
The second candidate for the vaccine was the bacillus of M. chelonae, which was poorly pathogenic. But since Friedman was Jewish, the rise of anti-Semitism led to a lawsuit against him in 1937, stopping the production of the vaccine in Italy at the request of Hitler, setting fire to the Friedman Institute in Leipzig, and banning the use of this vaccine in France in favor of attenuated M. bovis.
Children who drank milk infected with M. bovis seemed to be protected from more serious forms of pulmonary tuberculosis, so M. bovis became the third candidate for the vaccine, which was attenuated for 13 years. It was alleged that the vaccine caused lymphatic disease in guinea pigs, which spontaneously passed within 3 weeks. On the basis of this observation, the vaccine was started to be given to the newborn orally, despite the fact that BCG multiplied in various organs of guinea pigs for months. Calmette refused to assess the consequences of this observation. The vaccine also did not protect the monkeys from tuberculosis, but Calmette did not want to investigate it either. The effectiveness of the vaccine in children was overestimated, and the cases of meningitis in vaccinated people were explained by the contamination of the tuberculosis bacterium. The shortcomings of clinical trials and the misuse of statistics were revealed when Sweden refused universal vaccination and analyzed the consequences. It turned out that the number of side effects was 10 times higher than usual.
Chairman of the UNICEF Committee was the brother of an influential French politician who needed money and heroic achievements for the country after the Second World War. BCG, Calmette and the Pasteur Institute were good candidates for this, and UNICEF offered $3 million to WHO for the approval of the vaccine. WHO took a bribe and popularized the vaccine.
No one reacted to the undeniable epidemiological data on the inefficiency of the vaccine, identified as a result of a similar incidence in vaccine and nonvaccinating countries. No attention was paid to the catastrophic results of the South Indian study (paragraph 10). The assertion that BCG absolutely harmlessly paralyzed the studies concerning BCG-ita observed after vaccination.
